author: Sebastián Purgart
title: “Se desaconseja viajar”: La advertencia de la NWS para el fin de semana en California
text: El Servicio Meteorológico Nacional ha emitido una advertencia crucial para los residentes y viajeros en California este fin de semana. Se insta encarecidamente a evitar los viajes hacia y desde la Sierra Nevada debido a la llegada prevista de una tormenta invernal. Las condiciones extremas están pronosticadas para afectar una amplia área, incluidos importantes corredores como la Interestatal 80 y la Carretera 50, las dos carreteras principales que entran y salen de Tahoe Basin. "Se desaconseja encarecidamente viajar", señaló el NWS, en un alerta que destaca la gravedad del clima que se espera, con fuertes nevadas y condiciones peligrosas que podrían hacer que los viajes sean difíciles, si no imposibles. La seguridad pública es primordial en momentos como este, y se recomienda encarecidamente a todos tomar precauciones y seguir de cerca las actualizaciones meteorológicas. El pronóstico para la región indica que las nevadas intensas, con acumulaciones de hasta 1 a 3 pies de nieve fresca, podrían provocar cierres de carreteras, retrasos significativos y condiciones peligrosas para quienes se aventuren en las carreteras. En las áreas de recreación al aire libre, como la Cuenca Tahoe y el Parque Nacional Yosemite, que suelen ser destinos populares durante los fines de semana, se espera que las condiciones climáticas extremas afecten las actividades recreativas. Las intensas nevadas y las condiciones de viento adversas podrían interrumpir o incluso suspender actividades como el esquí, el snowboard y las caminatas. Se prevé que los acumulados de nieve sean particularmente altos en elevaciones más altas, con pronósticos que alcanzan hasta 2 a 3 pies en áreas como el Parque Nacional Yosemite. La advertencia de tormenta invernal rige desde las 17 horas local del viernes hasta el mismo horario del domingo. Esta situación hace imperativo que los residentes y los turistas estén al tanto de las actualizaciones meteorológicas y sigan las recomendaciones de seguridad emitidas por las autoridades pertinentes para garantizar su bienestar durante esta tormenta invernal pronosticada.

author: Charlie Potter
title: BOL Basketball Show: Alabama gears up for NCAA Tournament run
text:
BOL Basketball Show: Alabama gears up for NCAA Tournament run
March Madness has arrived, and Alabama is a No. 2 seed in the 2025 NCAA Tournament.
The Crimson Tide traveled to Cleveland, Ohio, on Wednesday, where it will face 15-seed Robert Morris in the first round on Friday, March 21. The matchup will tip off at 11:40 a.m. CT on truTV. The Alabama-Robert Morris winner will move on to the Round of 32 to take on either No. 7-seed Saint Mary’s or 10-seed Vanderbilt on Sunday, March 23 – also in Cleveland.
This is Alabama’s 25th NCAA Tournament appearance in program history, with the Tide owning a record of 27-24 (.529). UA is coming off the program’s first-ever Final Four appearance and has made the big dance five consecutive seasons under head coach Nate Oats.

Alabama enters the NCAA Tournament after losing to No. 1-seed Florida in the semifinals of the SEC Tournament. The Tide had won back-to-back games, including a win over the tournament’s No. 1 overall seed Auburn, before losing to the Gators in Nashville. In the defeat, Grant Nelson suffered a left knee injury and will be questionable for Friday’s first-round game.
Before Alabama takes on Robert Morris at Rocket Arena, BamaOnLine staff members Charlie Potter, Tim Watts and Blake Byler share their thoughts on the Tide and March Madness.

author: Shannen Ace
title: PHOTOS: Transportation and Ticket Center Security Line Stretches Into Parking Lot With Only One Lane Open During ... - WDW News Today
text:
It’s been a rainy day at Walt Disney World. With such poor weather, there weren’t many guests at Magic Kingdom, and only one security line has been operating at the Transportation and Ticket Center. This is where most guests go through security screening before entering the park. Unfortunately, as the rain has subsided, crowds of guests have arrived but only one line remains open.
Transportation and Ticket Center Security Line
When we were leaving the Transportation and Ticket Center between 1:00 p.m. and 1:20 p.m., the security line stretched under the bridge and into the disability parking lot.
Guests who took a tram from their car were being dropped off close to the security station but then had to walk back to the end of this line.
A Cast Member told us that there was a fire code in one of the parking lots that pulled several security officers away from the Transportation and Ticket Center.
Guests rushing to the back of the line also led some trams to make emergency stops due to danger.
Hopefully, another security screening station will open soon and the long line will be resolved.
All guests must go through security screening. In addition to the Transportation and Ticket Center, there are smaller security stations at the nearby resorts for park guests to go through.

author: MarketScreener
title: OpenAI rolls out GPT-4.5 for some paying users, to expand access next week -February 27, 2025 at 10:20 pm | MarketScreener
text:
(Reuters) - ChatGPT developer OpenAI said on Thursday it has released a research preview of its latest GPT-4.5 model for its Pro users and developers worldwide, with plans to expand access in the coming weeks.
GPT-4.5 comes with improved ability to recognize patterns, generate creative insights without reasoning and shows greater emotional intelligence, the company said.
Microsoft-backed OpenAI said it would begin rolling out GPT-4.5 to ChatGPT Plus and Team users next week, and then to Enterprise and Edu users the following week.
CEO Sam Altman called it "a giant, expensive model," saying the company ran out of GPU capacity to roll out to user tiers at the same time.
"We will add tens of thousands of GPUs next week ... this isn't how we want to operate, but it's hard to perfectly predict growth surges that lead to GPU shortages," he said in a post on X.
OpenAI said the model also has a lower rate of "hallucinations", a common issue in which large language models generate false information. At 37.1%, GPT-4.5's hallucination rate compares with the 61.8% shown by GPT-4o and 44% shown by its o1 reasoning model.
GPT-4.5 supports file and image uploads and can also work on writing and coding projects, but does not currently support other advanced features such as voice and video.
(Reporting by Deborah Sophia in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta)

author: John Asebes
title: Next phase of First Coast Expressway begins taking shape in St. Johns County
text:
ST. JOHNS COUNTY, Fla. – Signs of the First Coast Expressway began popping up in St. Johns County as the next phase of the project takes shape.
Residents said they are already noticing the changes, and the Florida Department of Transportation (FDOT) provided updates on what to expect.
Recommended Videos
Christi Alvarez, a resident of Shearwater, moved to the area two years ago, not far from Trout Creek Academy. She recalled the moment she first heard the construction noise.
“It was a total surprise,” she said.
RELATED | FDOT unveils plans for next phase of First Coast Expressway construction in St. Johns County
Around the southern part of the neighborhood, clearings and columns are visible, marking significant progress for FDOT.
The First Coast Expressway will eventually connect Interstate 10 to Interstate 95, providing direct access for residents on the Westside, as well as those in Clay and St. Johns counties.
Click here to view an interactive map of the project
This segment of the expressway, which runs east of County Road 16A to just east of St. Johns Parkway through the Silverleaf neighborhood, is estimated to cost $242 million.
This segment of the First Coast Expressway, which runs east of County Road 16A to just east of St. Johns Parkway through the Silverleaf neighborhood, is estimated to cost $242 million. (FDOT) Sara Pleasants from FDOT explained what residents can expect in the coming months.
“They will see some overpasses being built, with the piles for those, and then just new roadway construction, laying asphalt, curb and gutter, that kind of thing,” she said.
Just a short drive from a local Jersey Mike’s near Silver Leaf, some shoppers mentioned they have begun noticing the changes brought by the expressway.
MORE | Traffic relief in sight for Clay County commuters as First Coast Expressway project progresses
Pleasants went on to explain long-term project plans.
“This is a multi-year project. They started last fall on this segment, and it’ll continue, likely until around 2030. Later this year, we expect to see construction start on that final segment, which will be east of County Road 2209, from St. Johns Parkway to I-95,” Pleasants added.
Despite the noise and disruption, Alvarez sees the value in what’s coming.
“Shearwater is wonderful. I often say it’s kind of like a 55-and-over community for young families,” she said, highlighting the appeal of her neighborhood.
Pleasants explained some of the louder noise of the pile driving should be done in the next couple of weeks.
As construction progresses, the First Coast Expressway promises to enhance connectivity and accessibility for residents, paving the way for future growth in the region.

author: Todd Black
title: Arcane Season 2 Has Gotten Its First Look
text:
There once was a time when video game adaptations were something not to look forward to, as they were rarely, if ever, given the quality and respect they deserve. For every film that turned out to be good, or at least decent, there were plenty that weren’t. Animated projects were often better, especially ones with Sonic the Hedgehog and friends, but many franchises didn’t dare test these waters. But then, the team at
Riot Games decided to do things their own way and make a series dedicated to their games’ champions, and now, Arcane Season 2 has gotten its first teaser, and it’s a doozy.
To recap, the first season was about the story of VI and Jinx. The two sisters were brought up in incredibly different parts of society and forced to clash with one another. The show was so good that it wasn’t just a hit on Netflix; it won an Emmy award for its animation. The moment that season 1 was over, season 2 was anticipated. And with the teaser below, a key champion is about to make his debut in Arcane Season 2:
Yep, it’s none other than Warwick! The augmented wolf creature is one of the many experiments by Singed, and as the teaser highlights, the experiment to make Warwick what he needs to be is underway. The question here is, “Who is Warwick?” Well, he was a man that was turned into the beast you see. But his identity may change in the second season, as it’s heavily hinted that VI and Jinx’s father, Xander, might be the man whom Singed took and turned into the beast you see.
If this holds, then that means there will be plenty of “family drama” in season 2 to go around, and part of it will be the sisters having to team up to not just fight their father but potentially reach him from within his bestial form. Warwick, as a character, is full of rage due to the chemicals that Singed put in his body, so that won’t make him easily susceptible to pleas from his kids, not that he would recognize them in his wolf form.
The thing that fans are looking forward to the most is the worldbuilding and style that the first season had. The adaptation was beautiful, and while it took its sweet time to get made, fans will only have to wait until November for the second season to arrive.

author: ETtoday新聞雲
title: 落實低碳、公平與未來學習　Hami書城攜手空大啟動「電子教科書永續行動計畫」
text:
▲Hami書城攜手空大啟動「電子教科書永續行動計畫」。（圖／記者陳弘修翻攝，下同）
記者陳弘修／台北報導
在全球積極推動永續發展目標（SDGs）與ESG浪潮下，電子書平台也走向綠色升級。Hami書城於2025年4月正式取得「碳足跡標章」，成為全台唯一擁有該標章的電子書平台。今（12）日與國立空中大學攜手簽署「電子教科書永續行動計畫」，朝推廣綠色閱讀的道路邁進，為全台教育領域樹立嶄新低碳典範。
根據雙方合作內容，空大將逐步淘汰紙本教材，導入Hami書城提供的電子教科書平台，預估每年可減少近萬冊紙本教材印製量。這項計畫不僅落實「低碳學習」，更結合「未來學習」與「公平學習」三大願景，開創減紙與教育創新雙軌並行的新局。
Hami與空大12日的簽約儀式是在中華電信董事長簡志誠親自見證下完成。簡志誠表示，Hami書城與國立空大聯手啟動永續教科書計畫，是科技與教育攜手實踐永續發展的最佳示範。「感謝春水堂科技與國立空大，共同推動綠色閱讀，我們也期待更多教育機構加入，一起為地球盡一份心力。」
簡志誠強調，中華電信深耕ESG已久，此次合作具三大指標性意義：首先，Hami書城作為教科書上架平台，串聯課程資源並設置專屬入口，推動數位學習；第二，國立空大率先實踐減紙與教育創新雙目標，開啟無紙化學習時代；第三，透過數位平台提供偏鄉及弱勢學生平等的閱讀機會，促進教育公平。
春水堂科技董事長孟義超也指出，Hami書城多年來深耕數位閱讀，此次成為國立空大指定教科書平台，意義非凡。「透過這項合作，我們不僅實踐SDG4（優質教育）與SDG13（氣候行動），也協助弱勢族群縮小教育落差，推動數位平權，進一步形塑全民閱讀文化。」
孟義超強調，Hami書城與國立空大的這場合作，不只是教育場域的數位革新，更是為環境與下一代教育形塑未來的起點。隨著綠色閱讀新典範正式啟動，台灣的教育現場也將迎來更永續、更智慧的新篇章。
對於空大邁入節能減碳的新學習階段，國立空大校長許立一表示，學校與 Hami 書城的合作是持續落實本校三大核心願景的重要里程碑。首先是「數位轉型」，正式宣告從傳統紙本教科書步入數位出版時代；其次是「未來學習」，引領學生躍上雲端學習之路，培養與時俱進的數位素養；最後則是「永續發展」，推動低碳學習行動，具體實踐ESG及大學社會責任。
許立一強調，國立空大預計自明年推動教材無紙化行動，將可逐年減少近萬冊的教科書印刷量，以達節能減碳目標。
